original: tshig gis ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: tshig gis ni ngag gis so //

original: skye bo ma bsdams zhes bya ba ni tshul ngan pa ste ma dul ba'i rta srab dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skye bo ma bsdams zhes bya ba ni tshul ngan pa ste ma dul ba'i rta srab dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: Unrestrained people are of bad character, like wild horses without a bridle.üîΩWhat do they harm? The remainder of the verse is:

analyzed: gang la gnod par byed ce na yang dag par sdom pa la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are well restrained.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How?

original: g-yul ngor glang chen mda' yis bsnun pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /

original: dper na glang po'i mchog sa srung la sogs pa mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yang lha dang lha ma yin gyi g-yul ngo'i sar lha ma yin gyis mda' la sogs pa'i mtshon gyis rgyun du 'bigs shing snun par byed pa bzhin du yon tan brgya stong phrag dpag
analyzed: dper na glang po'i mchog sa srung la sogs pa mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yang lha dang lha ma yin gyi g-yul ngo'i sar lha ma yin gyis mda' la sogs pa'i mtshon gyis rgyun du 'bigs shing snun par byed pa bzhin du yon tan brgya stong phrag dpag
translated: For example, even the best of elephants, such as AirƒÅva·πáa, who are endowed with excellent characteristics, are constantly pierced and struck by the weapons of the demigods, such as arrows, in the battle arena of the gods and demigods.

original: tu med pas brgyan pa'i sems dpa' chen po yang skye bo dam pa ma yin pas rtsod pa'i dus su tshig rtsub po la sogs pa'i mda'i tshogs kyis gnod par byed de gang ma bsdams pa'i tshig gis gnod par byed do //
analyzed: tu med pas brgyan pa'i sems dpa' chen po yang skye bo dam pa ma yin pas rtsod pa'i dus su tshig rtsub po la sogs pa'i mda'i tshogs kyis gnod par byed de gang ma bsdams pa'i tshig gis gnod par byed do //
translated: The great beings who are adorned with patience are harmed by the arrows of harsh words and so forth of the unrighteous people of this degenerate age.

original: des na de dag ji ltar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na de dag ji ltar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they act?

original: thos gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni rab tu thos gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thos gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni rab tu thos gyur pa'o //
translated: Even though they hear it means even though they hear it well.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Words means they are harmed.

original: brjod pa ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni smra ba'o //
translated: Expression means they speak.

original: mi bzad pa ni tshig rtsub po ste gnad la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni tshig rtsub po ste gnad la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: Unbearable means harsh words that strike the vital point.

original: ji mi snyam zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: ji mi snyam zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Not minding means patience.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Bhik·π£u means one who is fully ordained by the rite of asking four times.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral bar gyur kyang dge spyod byed pa la rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral bar gyur kyang dge spyod byed pa la rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Even though they are not free from attachment, they engage in virtuous conduct.

original: de yang phyi rol la ji mi snyam pa ni ma yin gyi dge sbyong byed pa la gnas shing 'on kyang nang la bzod pa tsam ni yin te de yang mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang phyi rol la ji mi snyam pa ni ma yin gyi dge sbyong byed pa la gnas shing 'on kyang nang la bzod pa tsam ni yin te de yang mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is not indifference to external things, but rather it is patience with regard to the internal, i.e., with regard to the practice of the austerity of the mendicant.üîΩAnd that is characterized as non-perturbation.

original: de nyid kyang sdang sems bral la zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang sdang sems bral la zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: And that is also stated as being free from the mind of hatred.

original: 'tshe ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of the intention to harm.

original: yang dag par yongs su brtags pas 'di nyid kyis bzod par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su brtags pas 'di nyid kyis bzod par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one is able to be patient through correct investigation, and not through anything else, he says:

original: skye bo ma bsdams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skye bo ma bsdams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The person who is not restrained, etc.

original: legs gzhag la zhes bya ba ni shes rab sngon du 'gro zhing snying rje gzung ba byas la nges @182b par gzhag pa yin no //üîΩgang zhe na yid ces bya ba ni sems te yang dag pa nyid du gzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: legs gzhag la zhes bya ba ni shes rab sngon du 'gro zhing snying rje gzung ba byas la nges @182b par gzhag pa yin no // gang zhe na yid ces bya ba ni sems te yang dag pa nyid du gzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is well-established is that which is established in reality, preceded by wisdom and accompanied by compassion.üîΩWhat is that? The mind. Consciousness that is well-established.

original: gang legs par gzhag pa'i yid de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang legs par gzhag pa'i yid de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that mind that is well-established?

original: bzo yis mi 'tsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzo yis mi 'tsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, you should not live by crafts.üîΩThe monks sat in a circle and discussed this, saying, Venerables, the crafts are well-established.

original: dge slong dag dkyil 'khor bzhin du gnas shing 'khod nas gtam rjod par byed de btsun pa dag bzo'i gnas ni legs par gzhag pa yin no zhes pa nas ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das gshegs te 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag dkyil 'khor bzhin du gnas shing 'khod nas gtam rjod par byed de btsun pa dag bzo'i gnas ni legs par gzhag pa yin no zhes pa nas ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das gshegs te 'di gsungs so //
translated: Up to the Blessed One coming and saying this:

original: bzo ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa yang brdung ba dang / yi ge la sogs pa mkhas par byas pa des 'tsho ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa ste /
analyzed: bzo ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa yang brdung ba dang / yi ge la sogs pa mkhas par byas pa des 'tsho ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa ste /
translated: Crafts means that one lives by the nature of beating gold, silver, and so on, and by becoming skilled in writing and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bzo byas kyang mi 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bzo byas kyang mi 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Even if one makes crafts other than that, one does not live by it.

original: ji ltar na dge slong de ni bzo la brten nas 'tsho ba gnas par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong de ni bzo la brten nas 'tsho ba gnas par byed pa ma yin te /

original: tshul 'di ni khyim pa'i skye bo yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni khyim pa'i skye bo yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: This is the way of householders.

original: spang ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa bstan te yo byad mang po mi bya ba dang / 'tshog chas mang po ma yin pa dang / legs par bkod pa'i tshul dang / ma smin pa'i 'bru len pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa bstan te yo byad mang po mi bya ba dang / 'tshog chas mang po ma yin pa dang / legs par bkod pa'i tshul dang / ma smin pa'i 'bru len pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is taught as the austerity of belongings: one should not have many belongings, one should not have many provisions, one should have a well-ordered way of life, one should abandon taking unripe grain.

original: bdag la dga' zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la 'dod par byed cing bdag la dga' ba gang yin pa des ni legs par spyod pa la rtag tu mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la dga' zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la 'dod par byed cing bdag la dga' ba gang yin pa des ni legs par spyod pa la rtag tu mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The phrase who delights in himself means that one who delights in himself, who takes pleasure in himself, always delights in good conduct.

original: ji ltar yang dge slong bdag la dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dge slong bdag la dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk who delights in himself?

original: 'di ni gcig tu dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong la dga' ba dang / bslab pa 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig tu dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong la dga' ba dang / bslab pa 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is one who holds the ascetic life as paramount, who delights in the ascetic life, who desires training, and so on.

original: 'dis dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bstan nas dbang po'i sdom pa smras pa /üîΩdbang po dul ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'dis dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bstan nas dbang po'i sdom pa smras pa / dbang po dul ba zhes smos te /
translated: Having taught the aspiration for virtuous qualities, he states the restraint of the faculties:üîΩThe phrase with faculties restrained means

original: dbang po dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faculties are restrained.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa bstan to //

original: kun las rnam grol zhing zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i yan lag thams cad dang / sdig pa'i rgyu thams cad las te sdig pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar khyim pas ni byed par mi nus kyi rab tu byung bas nus pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: kun las rnam grol zhing zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i yan lag thams cad dang / sdig pa'i rgyu thams cad las te sdig pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro // de ltar khyim pas ni byed par mi nus kyi rab tu byung bas nus pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The line freed from all means freed from all branches of sin and all causes of sin, because one turns away from sin.

original: khyim la ma chags zhes bya ba ste khyim snying por byed pa gang yin pa de ni khyim snying por byed pa ste khyim len cing chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyim la ma chags zhes bya ba ste khyim snying por byed pa gang yin pa de ni khyim snying por byed pa ste khyim len cing chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, a householder cannot do this, but one who has gone forth can, so it is said: Not attached to the home. The one who makes the home essential is the one who makes the home essential. The one who takes up and is attached to the home is the one who makes the home essential.

original: de las gzhan pa ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who is different from that is called one who has gone forth.

analyzed: de nas tshul khrims la brten nas lam bsgom pa'i khyad par smras pa / bdag @183a * //
translated: Then, based on morality, the special cultivation of the path is stated:

analyzed: med ces bya ba ste 'jig tshogs la lta ba med pa'i phyir mthong pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: The line no self teaches the path of seeing because there is no view of the transitory collection.

original: sred pa spangs pa zhes bya pa ni sred pa spangs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa zhes bya pa ni sred pa spangs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: The line abandoned craving teaches the path of cultivation because craving is abandoned.

original: gang gi tshe lam gnyis kyis dang po spang bar bya ba yongs su shes pa de'i tshe bshad pa 'dod spangs zhes bya ba ste dang po 'dod pa'i khams spangs pa'o //

original: gcig tu spyod pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i phyir te /üîΩde nyid don dam pa'i dge slong yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu spyod pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i phyir te / de nyid don dam pa'i dge slong yin no //
translated: He is a ‚Äúmonk who has attained the destruction of suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe Buddha said to the naked ascetic Ka·πáhaka, a follower of the ƒÄjƒ´vikas:

original: dge slong de nyid ni sdug bsngal zad pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong de nyid ni sdug bsngal zad pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúKa·πáhaka, a monk who is a true renouncer of desire, who is a single-practicer, who is a true monk, who is a monk who has attained the destruction of suffering, who is a true ascetic, who is a true brƒÅhma·πáa, who is a true renouncer, who is a true brahmin, who is a true holy person, who is a true noble person, who is a true noble one‚Äîsuch a monk, Ka·πáhaka, is called a ‚Äòmonk who has attained the destruction of suffering.‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'tsho gtsang zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'tsho gtsang zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Buddha said to the naked ascetic Ka·πáhaka, a follower of the ƒÄjƒ´vikas:üîΩ‚ÄúKa·πáhaka, a monk who is a true renouncer of desire, who is a single-practicer, who is a true monk, who is a monk who has attained the destruction of suffering, who is a true ascetic, who is a true brƒÅhma·πáa, who is a true renouncer, who is a true brahmin, who is a true holy person, who is a true noble person, who is a true noble one‚Äîsuch a monk, Ka·πáhaka, is called a ‚Äòmonk who has attained the destruction of suffering.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩThe Buddha said to the naked ascetic Ka·πáhaka, a follower of the ƒÄjƒ´vikas:

analyzed: kun du rgyu nag po rgyun shes zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa ci tsam gyis na dge slong sdug bsngal zad pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes gsol pa dang / 'di gsungs so //üîΩgrogs po mthun pa bsten bya zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúKa·πáhaka, a monk who is a true renouncer of desire, who is a single-practicer, who is a true monk, who is a monk who has attained the destruction of suffering, who is a true ascetic, who is a true brƒÅhma·πáa, who is a true renouncer, who is a true brahmin, who is a true holy person, who is a true noble person, who is a true noble one‚Äîsuch a monk, Ka·πáhaka, is called a ‚Äòmonk who has attained the destruction of suffering.‚Äô‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la mnyam pa 'am khyad par du gyur pa'i dge ba'i grogs po phan 'dogs par byed pa ni bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mnyam pa 'am khyad par du gyur pa'i dge ba'i grogs po phan 'dogs par byed pa ni bsten par bya ste /
translated: One should rely on a spiritual friend who is equal or superior, who is helpful.

original: gang la brten nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'grib pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel ba de ni mthun pa'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: gang la brten nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'grib pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel ba de ni mthun pa'i grogs po'o //
translated: He is a spiritual friend who, when one relies on him, causes unwholesome factors to decrease and wholesome factors to increase.

original: 'tsho gtsang zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i kun du 'tsho pa'i yo byad gang yin pa ste log pa'i 'tsho ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho gtsang zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i kun du 'tsho pa'i yo byad gang yin pa ste log pa'i 'tsho ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure livelihood is the means of livelihood that is pure, because wrong livelihood is abandoned.

original: bslab ba bsrung ba'i rim pa bstan pa /
analyzed: bslab ba bsrung ba'i rim pa bstan pa /
translated: The stages of guarding the training are explained.

original: snyom las med pa zhes bya ba ste yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyom las med pa zhes bya ba ste yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should be without laziness, because one is without grasping.

original: gang gi phyir yongs su gzung ba yod pa ni snyom las skye bar 'gyur te gang dag myu gu mang por 'phros pa'i shing bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su gzung ba yod pa ni snyom las skye bar 'gyur te gang dag myu gu mang por 'phros pa'i shing bzhin no //
translated: Because of the existence of grasping, laziness arises, like a tree with many spreading branches.

original: de bkag pas ni snyom las med pa ste /
analyzed: de bkag pas ni snyom las med pa ste /
translated: By stopping that, one is without laziness.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gzung bya mi 'dzin dge slong dang // thibs po'i nang du g-yag gnas dang // dgon du ma he gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzung bya mi 'dzin dge slong dang // thibs po'i nang du g-yag gnas dang // dgon du ma he gnas pa ste /
translated: The monk who does not take what is not given, the yak who lives in the forest, and the buffalo who lives in the wilderness‚Äî

original: gsum po 'di dag 'chi bar phyogs //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag 'chi bar phyogs //
translated: these three are headed for death.

original: zhes pa'o // yongs su gzung ba med kyang de ci nus par gzhan la phan par byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yongs su gzung ba med kyang de ci nus par gzhan la phan par byed de /
translated: Even without possessions, he benefits others as much as he can.

original: 'di ltar so sor bgo bsha' bya ba dang zhes bya ba so sor bgo bsha'i sgo nas kyang de ltar khyad par du phan 'dogs pa de la 'jug cing 'di ltar rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor bgo bsha' bya ba dang zhes bya ba so sor bgo bsha'i sgo nas kyang de ltar khyad par du phan 'dogs pa de la 'jug cing 'di ltar rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, he engages in and enters into the practice of benefiting others through the distribution of his own body and possessions.

original: bgo bsha' yang rnam pa gnyis te chos kyis so sor bgo bsha' bya ba dang / zang zing @183b gis so sor bgo bsha' bya ba'o zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bgo bsha' yang rnam pa gnyis te chos kyis so sor bgo bsha' bya ba dang / zang zing @183b gis so sor bgo bsha' bya ba'o zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The distribution is twofold: distribution through the Dharma and distribution through material things.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pas 'tsho ba kun du dag pa dang / yongs su gzung ba med cing gtong bar gyur na ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pas 'tsho ba kun du dag pa dang / yongs su gzung ba med cing gtong bar gyur na ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When he lives in dependence on holy people, his livelihood becomes pure. When he becomes free of possessions and a renunciate, he benefits others in every way.

original: bdag nyid dam pa'i tshul mchog tu byed pas gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid dam pa'i tshul mchog tu byed pas gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: One is able to benefit others by becoming supreme in the excellent way, but not otherwise.

original: spyod yul cho ga mkhas par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: spyod yul cho ga mkhas par bya // zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: One should be skilled in the rules of proper conduct.

original: bslab pa dang nye ba'i bslab pa bsrung ba la mkhas par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bslab pa dang nye ba'i bslab pa bsrung ba la mkhas par 'gyur bas so //
translated: One should be skilled in guarding the precepts and the subsidiary precepts.

original: ci'i phyir spyod yul gyi cho ga mkhas pa la sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spyod yul gyi cho ga mkhas pa la sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is one skilled in the rules of proper conduct?

original: 'di ltar spyod yul cho ga mkhas pa yis //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyod yul cho ga mkhas pa yis // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One who is skilled in the rules of proper conduct

original: dam pa'i spyod pa la dga' bas 'dul ba bzhin du sde snod gsum du bstan pa'i cho ga dang rjes su mthun pas tshul khrims yongs su shes pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i spyod pa la dga' bas 'dul ba bzhin du sde snod gsum du bstan pa'i cho ga dang rjes su mthun pas tshul khrims yongs su shes pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is skilled in the rules of proper conduct is skilled in the three scriptural collections, and is skilled in the three trainings.

original: de lta bu'i dge slong des 'bras bu ji zhig 'thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dge slong des 'bras bu ji zhig 'thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: What result does such a monk obtain?

original: sdug bsngal zad pa zhes bya ba 'khor ba las thar pa 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa zhes bya ba 'khor ba las thar pa 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The result is the exhaustion of suffering, which is the attainment of liberation from cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar yang dge slong spyod yul gyi cho ga la mkhas pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pas nye bar mtshon pa'i skye ba yongs su spangs pa'o //

original: gal te ma spangs na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma spangs na cir 'gyur zhe na /

original: gang yang de ltar gyur pas lhag ma dang bcas kyang bdud las thar pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gang yang de ltar gyur pas lhag ma dang bcas kyang bdud las thar pa yin no zhes bstan te /

analyzed: de ni bdud kyi 'ching las grol //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: gang yang bsgrub par bya ba'i dbang po sdom par bshad pa /

original: de bas de spangs pa'i phan yon smras pa /
analyzed: de bas de spangs pa'i phan yon smras pa /

original: srid pa'i sred pa gtubs gyur pa //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa gtubs gyur pa //

original: zhes bya ba srid pa gsum gyis srid pa gang gis drungs phyung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba srid pa gsum gyis srid pa gang gis drungs phyung ba ste /

analyzed: sred pa spangs pas ni 'dod pa'i phan yon spangs par bstan to //

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dge slong ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dge slong ngo //

original: 'dam rdzab ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dam rdzab ni 'dod pa ste /

analyzed: chos kyi sku la gnod pa byed pas tsher ma dang chos mthun pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan nas /

analyzed: khams gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan pa / 'dod chags zad pa rjes thob pa //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

translated: Therefore, it should be understood that not meditating on what is taught is not the highest practice.

original: smra bar mi byed pa ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor can de nyid sbyor ba goms par byed pas mi gtsang ba sgom pa la gzhol zhing yid la byed pa'i lus la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa la 'bad par mi byed do //
analyzed: smra bar mi byed pa ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor can de nyid sbyor ba goms par byed pas mi gtsang ba sgom pa la gzhol zhing yid la byed pa'i lus la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa la 'bad par mi byed do //
translated: Not speaking: When the yogi/nƒ´ is engaged in the practice of familiarization, they do not apply themselves to the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness of the body, etc. by focusing on and attending to the meditation on impurity.

original: brkam par gyur pas don du gnyer ba'i bdag nyid yin gyi brjod pas ni de'i tshe khyad par thob pa yang nyams par byed na sdar ma bsgrubs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: brkam par gyur pas don du gnyer ba'i bdag nyid yin gyi brjod pas ni de'i tshe khyad par thob pa yang nyams par byed na sdar ma bsgrubs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: Since they are greedy, they are intent on their own aims. At that time, they would fall away from even the attainment of a special state, let alone the accomplishment of the former.

original: des na myur ba'i theg pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: des na myur ba'i theg pa thob par byed do //
translated: Therefore, they attain the vehicle of the swift.

original: yang na gnyi ga dang 'gal ba'i yid la byed pa'i bstan pa nyan pa'i bstan pa nyan pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdig can rnam par mi sems shing //
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga dang 'gal ba'i yid la byed pa'i bstan pa nyan pa'i bstan pa nyan pa med pa'i phyir ro // sdig can rnam par mi sems shing //
translated: Or else, because there is no listening to the teaching that is contrary to both.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase the wicked do not think means that one does not attend to thoughts of desire, etc.

original: sprin chen de'i sbyor bas ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa 'dir dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sprin chen de'i sbyor bas ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa 'dir dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: The simile of the great cloud is to be applied to this concentration that is not a concentration.

original: sems dben pa bstan nas lus dben pa bshad pa /
analyzed: sems dben pa bstan nas lus dben pa bshad pa /
translated: Having taught mental solitude, he teaches bodily solitude:

original: 'dug nas smos te shing drung la sogs pa dben par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug nas smos te shing drung la sogs pa dben par 'dug pa'o //
translated: Sitting means sitting in solitude under a tree, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rdul bral zhes bya ba ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rdul bral zhes bya ba ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The result of that is freedom from dust, which is freedom from passion.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bstan pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bstan pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: The phrase dwelling in comfort in this very life teaches mental solitude.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs thob pas yid dben pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs thob pas yid dben pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach mental solitude by attaining the family of the noble ones,

original: gang zhig phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhoever wears cast off rags, etc.‚Äù

original: de nas rgyal rigs shig bdag nyid dmyal bar skyes pa rmi lam gyi nang du mthong ste mi rigs par spyad pa gang gis 'dir skyes par gyur ces dang / btson ra'i mchog bum pa'i nang na gnas pa ni mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal rigs shig bdag nyid dmyal bar skyes pa rmi lam gyi nang du mthong ste mi rigs par spyad pa gang gis 'dir skyes par gyur ces dang / btson ra'i mchog bum pa'i nang na gnas pa ni mi rigs pas so //
translated: He saw the best of prisons, the womb, and understood that it was due to unwholesome action.

original: gzhan gyi nor nyams par byas pas ni zangs zhun gyi zhu ba'i gos kyis lus la bskon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor nyams par byas pas ni zangs zhun gyi zhu ba'i gos kyis lus la bskon par 'gyur ro //
translated: He saw that by stealing others‚Äô property, one is wrapped in molten copper.

original: @214b tshig ngan pas ni de gtun gyis phye mar byed cing 'dzoms la brdungs pas gnod par byed do //
analyzed: @214b tshig ngan pas ni de gtun gyis phye mar byed cing 'dzoms la brdungs pas gnod par byed do //
translated: By harsh speech, one is ground to powder with pestles and pounded with mallets.

original: dbyen gyis ni sog les 'dra ba la sogs pa mthong nas skyo ba skyes te /
analyzed: dbyen gyis ni sog les 'dra ba la sogs pa mthong nas skyo ba skyes te /
translated: By divisive speech, one sees saws and so on, and becomes frightened.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song zhing rab tu byung nas dgon par song ste phyag dar khrod 'chang zhing rtsva'i stan la 'dug nas ji tsam na khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral te de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song zhing rab tu byung nas dgon par song ste phyag dar khrod 'chang zhing rtsva'i stan la 'dug nas ji tsam na khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral te de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: He went to the Blessed One, went forth, went to the wilderness, took up rags, sat on a grass seat, and became free from attachment to the three realms. This was taught with reference to him.

original: byi bas zos pa la sogs pa'i gos gang phyag dar gyi phung po la sogs par bor nas phyag dar khrod du lhung ba ni phyag dar khrod de /
analyzed: byi bas zos pa la sogs pa'i gos gang phyag dar gyi phung po la sogs par bor nas phyag dar khrod du lhung ba ni phyag dar khrod de /
translated: The cloth that is discarded in a heap of rubbish, such as that eaten by rats, etc., is called ‚Äúrefuse rag.‚Äù

original: de blangs nas bkru ba dang btsem pa dang btso ba la sogs pas yongs su sbyor zhing 'dzin pa ni phyag dar khrod 'chang ba ste 'dis ni chos gos ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de blangs nas bkru ba dang btsem pa dang btso ba la sogs pas yongs su sbyor zhing 'dzin pa ni phyag dar khrod 'chang ba ste 'dis ni chos gos ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to //
translated: One who takes it, and then processes it by washing, sewing, dyeing, etc., and wears it is a ‚Äúwearer of refuse rags.‚Äù This shows that he is satisfied with just the bare necessities of robes.

original: ngo tsha shes pa ni 'dzem pa dang ldan pa ste bsod snyoms ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa ni 'dzem pa dang ldan pa ste bsod snyoms ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to //
translated: He is ‚Äúmodest‚Äù in that he is conscientious. This shows that he is satisfied with just the bare necessities of alms-food.

original: ngo tsha dang bcas pas ni gos la sogs pa gzhan las slong gi kha zas ni ma yin te de don du gnyer ba ni smad pa'i dngos po yin pas mi 'dzem pa yin la /
analyzed: ngo tsha dang bcas pas ni gos la sogs pa gzhan las slong gi kha zas ni ma yin te de don du gnyer ba ni smad pa'i dngos po yin pas mi 'dzem pa yin la /
translated: He does not beg others for robes, etc., because he is modest, but not for alms-food, because he is not conscientious about seeking it, since it is a despised thing.

original: 'dir don du gnyer bar yang mi byed de 'dis ni gya nom pa slong ba med par ston to //
analyzed: 'dir don du gnyer bar yang mi byed de 'dis ni gya nom pa slong ba med par ston to //
translated: He does not even seek it here, and this shows that he does not beg for fine things.

original: 'dod mi lta zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa thams cad la lhag par zhen pa spangs pa ste 'dis ni spong ba bsgom pa la dga' ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod mi lta zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa thams cad la lhag par zhen pa spangs pa ste 'dis ni spong ba bsgom pa la dga' ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase one who does not desire means that one has abandoned attachment to all desires. This shows that one delights in cultivating the abandonment of desire.

original: shing drung dag tu gnas pa zhes bya bas ni gnas mal ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to //üîΩyang na phyag dar khrod 'chang zhing //
analyzed: shing drung dag tu gnas pa zhes bya bas ni gnas mal ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa bstan to // yang na phyag dar khrod 'chang zhing //
translated: The phrase one who dwells at the foot of a tree shows that one is content with whatever bed or seat one can find.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni go rims bzhin du lus dang sems gdul ba dang / lus dang sems dben pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni go rims bzhin du lus dang sems gdul ba dang / lus dang sems dben pa bstan to //
translated: Or, one who wears rags obtained from a heap of rubbish and so on. In this way, one trains the body and mind, and one becomes secluded in body and mind.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bsgom pa ji lta ba de bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bsgom pa ji lta ba de bshad pa /
translated: The Blessed One taught the four noble lineages in order to show that one should not be attached to either pleasure or pain.üîΩThe phrase one who is not attached to pleasure shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the five sensory objects.

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who is not attached to pain shows that one does not delight in the pain of harming oneself.üîΩThe phrase one who is not attached to the pleasure of renunciation shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the absorptions.üîΩThe phrase one who is not attached to the pleasure of equanimity shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the formless states.üîΩThe Blessed One taught the four noble lineages in order to show that one should not be attached to either pleasure or pain. The phrase one who is not attached to pleasure shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the five sensory objects.

original: gzhan dka' thub can zhig dka' thub drag pos rnam par grol bar 'dod cing phyogs bzhi nas tsher ma rnam pa bzhi la yongs su 'gre zhing 'dug pa gzigs nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan cing de'i 'og tu 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan dka' thub can zhig dka' thub drag pos rnam par grol bar 'dod cing phyogs bzhi nas tsher ma rnam pa bzhi la yongs su 'gre zhing 'dug pa gzigs nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan cing de'i 'og tu 'di gsungs so //
translated: The phrase one who is not attached to pain shows that one does not delight in the pain of harming oneself.üîΩThe phrase one who is not attached to the pleasure of renunciation shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the absorptions.üîΩThe phrase one who is not attached to the pleasure of equanimity shows that one does not delight in the pleasure of the formless states.

original: lam ni thar pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: lam ni thar pa'i thabs so //
translated: The path is the means to liberation.

original: legs par sgom par byed pa ni gang zhig legs par bsten pa ste gang zhe na /
analyzed: legs par sgom par byed pa ni gang zhig legs par bsten pa ste gang zhe na /
translated: The one who cultivates it well is the one who practices it well.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de zag pa med pa'i yan lag brgyad dang @215a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de zag pa med pa'i yan lag brgyad dang @215a * //
translated: What is it? It is the noble eightfold path, which is endowed with the eight pure members.

original: ldan pa'o ; / de ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa'o ; / de ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: drang po zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / bgrod pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang po zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / bgrod pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is straight, because it is the side of happiness, etc., and because it is the one path.

original: zhi ba ni me nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni me nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is peaceful, because it is the means to extinguish the fire of the defilements.

original: lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a view.

original: yang na ci'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Or else, why is it called noble?

original: drang po ste zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang po ste zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is straight, because it is free from the impurities.

original: ci'i phyir yan lag brgyad ce na 'di ltar zhi ba ste bkra shis pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yan lag brgyad ce na 'di ltar zhi ba ste bkra shis pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it called the eightfold path? Because it is peaceful, that is, auspicious,

original: yang dag pa'i ltab la sogs pa yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ltab la sogs pa yan lag brgyad do //
translated: it is the eight members, right view, etc.

original: gang gi don du 'di sgom par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi don du 'di sgom par byed ce na /
translated: For whose benefit is it cultivated?

original: sdug bsngal kun spangs phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun spangs phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because all suffering is abandoned.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'gro ba'i go skabs med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang la cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'gro ba'i go skabs med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang la cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the result of the noble path is the absence of any possibility for transmigration, he says:üîΩThere is nothing whatsoever that abides anywhere.üîΩThen, a great many brahmins gathered together and said to the Blessed One: Please sit down and we will serve you.

original: de nas bram ze rab tu mang po gcig tu 'dus shing tshogs pa las bcom ldan 'das la bzhugs nas bstabs so zhes rgya cher te bzhugs pa las tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu rgyang ring po nas gzigs te de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs suüîΩbcad pa 'di'o //
analyzed: de nas bram ze rab tu mang po gcig tu 'dus shing tshogs pa las bcom ldan 'das la bzhugs nas bstabs so zhes rgya cher te bzhugs pa las tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu rgyang ring po nas gzigs te de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di'o //
translated: The Blessed One sat down, and the venerable Maudgalyayana saw him from afar. With him in mind, he spoke this verse:

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
translated: Here, someone refers to sentient beings.

original: gnas pa ni kun du 'dzin cing yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun du 'dzin cing yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Abiding means grasping and holding on.

original: cung zad med ces bya ba ni gang na yang ngo //
analyzed: cung zad med ces bya ba ni gang na yang ngo //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever means anywhere.

original: yang na gnas ni 'gro ba'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: yang na gnas ni 'gro ba'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Alternatively, abiding refers to the state of transmigrating beings.

original: de ni cung zad kyang gang na yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni cung zad kyang gang na yang med pa'o //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever of that anywhere.

original: yang na gang gis kun du 'dzin par byed pa'i gnas gang la yod pa de sred pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gis kun du 'dzin par byed pa'i gnas gang la yod pa de sred pa'o //
translated: Or else, craving is that which exists as the basis for the grasping of anything.

original: kun shes ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: kun shes ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir te de ni gnas med do //
translated: One who is fully aware is one who has attained the knowledge of the destruction and non-arising of the defilements.

original: rim pa gang gis kun shes pa dang ldan pa yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: rim pa gang gis kun shes pa dang ldan pa yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: By what stages is one fully aware?

original: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ste mthong ba'i lam gyi the tshom spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ste mthong ba'i lam gyi the tshom spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is free from doubt is one who has abandoned doubt on the path of vision.

original: zug rdu med pa ni bsgom pas nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zug rdu med pa ni bsgom pas nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is free from the dart is one who is free from all the defilements by the path of meditative development.

original: 'chi med go 'phang thob pa de //
analyzed: 'chi med go 'phang thob pa de //
translated: One who has attained the state of immortality

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is one who attains nirvana with a remainder of clinging.

original: lam kho na sems dul bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam kho na sems dul bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that only the path is the taming of the mind, he says:

original: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The body is not tamed by the body itself,üîΩbut the body is tamed by the mind.

original: gang zhig btul bas thams cad thul bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig btul bas thams cad thul bar 'gyur //
translated: When the mind is tamed, everything is tamed.

original: zhes kha lo sgyur bas zhus pa las 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes kha lo sgyur bas zhus pa las 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in response to the question in the Chandogasutra.

original: ring du 'gro ba ni 'dzin par byed pa ma thob pa ste yul ring ba gnas dum dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du 'gro ba ni 'dzin par byed pa ma thob pa ste yul ring ba gnas dum dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing far‚Äù means not obtaining the holder, because it holds distant objects for a long time.

original: gcig pu rgyu zhes bya ba ni re re @215b 'jug pa tshe 'dir sems kyi rgyud ni gcig go zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: gcig pu rgyu zhes bya ba ni re re @215b 'jug pa tshe 'dir sems kyi rgyud ni gcig go zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing alone‚Äù means that the mindstream is single in this life, as stated by the phrase ‚Äúgoing alone.‚Äù

original: lus med pa ni gzugs med pas so //
analyzed: lus med pa ni gzugs med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBodiless‚Äù means formless.

original: phug na gnas pa ni ming dang gzugs bsten pa ste gang gi phyir khams gnyis na ni gzugs la brten la /
analyzed: phug na gnas pa ni ming dang gzugs bsten pa ste gang gi phyir khams gnyis na ni gzugs la brten la /
translated: ‚ÄúDwelling in a cave‚Äù means dependent on name-and-form, because in the two realms, the mind depends on form,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sems ris mthun pa dang srog la brten pas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sems ris mthun pa dang srog la brten pas so //
translated: and in the formless realm, the mind depends on the homogeneous class and life force.

original: gdul dka' ba ni dka' bas gdul bar byas ba yin te /
analyzed: gdul dka' ba ni dka' bas gdul bar byas ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifficult to tame‚Äù means that it is tamed with difficulty,

original: ring du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it goes far, etc.

original: sems dul ba thob na ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas so //
analyzed: sems dul ba thob na ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pas so //
translated: In order to show that when the mind is tamed, nirvana is obtained, it is said: ‚ÄúWhoever is bodiless, etc.‚Äù

original: de nas tshangs pa'i tshe zhes bya ba'i bram ze bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs te 'di skad ces gsol te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i tshe zhes bya ba'i bram ze bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs te 'di skad ces gsol te /
translated: Then a Brahmin named Brahmadatta came into the presence of the Blessed One and said this:üîΩ‚ÄúVenerable One, what is the state that, when realized, becomes the ultimate Brahmin?‚Äù

original: btsun pa go 'phang gang zhig rtogs na don dam pa'i bram zer 'gyur zhes gsol pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa go 'phang gang zhig rtogs na don dam pa'i bram zer 'gyur zhes gsol pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: gang la gzugs med pa de ni gzugs med de gzhi rnam pa bcu gcig gis gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la gzugs med pa de ni gzugs med de gzhi rnam pa bcu gcig gis gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has no form is formless, because it is formless in eleven ways.

original: bltar med ni 'di ni 'di'o zhes nges par bstan par mi rung ba ste de lta bu'i dper brjod pa gzhan med cing mi snang bas so //
analyzed: bltar med ni 'di ni 'di'o zhes nges par bstan par mi rung ba ste de lta bu'i dper brjod pa gzhan med cing mi snang bas so //
translated: It is invisible, because it is not suitable to be pointed out as ‚Äúhere it is,‚Äù since there is no other example like it that appears.

original: mtha' yas pa ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: It is infinite, because it is limitless.

original: thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space, because it pervades everything.

original: shin tu bltar med ces bya ni rtogs par dka' bas so //
analyzed: shin tu bltar med ces bya ni rtogs par dka' bas so //
translated: It is extremely invisible, because it is difficult to realize.

original: phra ba ni dbang po la sogs pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni dbang po la sogs pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is subtle, because it transcends the senses and so forth.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi gnod pa'i gzhi ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi gnod pa'i gzhi ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa'i gnas so //
translated: The basis that is not harmed by the harm of birth, etc. is the state called nirvana.

original: mngon rtogs ni 'gog pa shes pas ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon rtogs ni 'gog pa shes pas ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realization is the realization of the truth by the knowledge of cessation.

original: spyod pa ni 'jig rten gzhan la phan pa'i phyir spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni 'jig rten gzhan la phan pa'i phyir spyod pa'o //
translated: Conduct is the conduct for the benefit of other worlds.

original: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid bshad pa /

original: rtag dran zhes bya ba ste rgyun mi nyams pa'i dran pa la rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pas so //
analyzed: rtag dran zhes bya ba ste rgyun mi nyams pa'i dran pa la rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pas so //

original: kun sbyor zad pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun sbyor zad pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the perfection of abandonment,

analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni sangs rgyas zhes pas bstan to // gang bcad nas dul bar 'gyur ba de smras pa /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is taught by Buddhahood.üîΩHaving explained the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of power is taught by the one who has cut off the net of questions.üîΩThe one who has cut off the net of questions is the one who has cut off the net of questions.

original: gang zhig sog mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig sog mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The one who has cut off the net of questions is the one who has cut off the net of questions.

original: rig byed 'don pa'i bram ze gnyis shig rigs @216a * //
analyzed: rig byed 'don pa'i bram ze gnyis shig rigs @216a * //
translated: Two Brahmins who recited the Vedas,

original: kyis bsnyems shing dregs la /
analyzed: kyis bsnyems shing dregs la /
translated: arrogant and proud because of their caste,

original: shin du brkam zhing phongs pa de gnyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor stong phrag du ma'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: shin du brkam zhing phongs pa de gnyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor stong phrag du ma'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: very greedy and poor, entered the midst of a circle of many thousands of followers,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: approached the Blessed One,

original: kye goo ta ma 'jig rten na ni bram ze mchod ba yin no zhes zhus pa dang zhu ba po gnyis las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kye goo ta ma 'jig rten na ni bram ze mchod ba yin no zhes zhus pa dang zhu ba po gnyis las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: and said, O Gautama, in the world, the Brahmins are to be worshipped.

original: gtubs pa ni bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gtubs pa ni bcad pa'o //
translated: Cutting means cutting.

original: 'ching ba ni 'dis 'dzin par byed pa yin pas zhes byas nas te nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'jig tshogs la lta bar byed cing sems 'dzin par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni 'dis 'dzin par byed pa yin pas zhes byas nas te nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'jig tshogs la lta bar byed cing sems 'dzin par byed pas so //
translated: Binding means this is the one who grasps, thinking I am, and it causes the view of the transitory collection to grasp the mind.

original: gzhan dag ni zhe sdang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhe sdang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say it is hatred.

original: sog mig zhes bya ba ni pags pa'i rang bzhin gyi thag pa ste 'dir ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: sog mig zhes bya ba ni pags pa'i rang bzhin gyi thag pa ste 'dir ni sred pa'o //
translated: Eye of the needle refers to a rope made of skin, which here is craving.

original: dper na shing rta'i 'og nas thams cad du shing yongs su bcings nas sog mig dang chings ma byas na khur 'degs pa'i nus pa yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing rta'i 'og nas thams cad du shing yongs su bcings nas sog mig dang chings ma byas na khur 'degs pa'i nus pa yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when a cart is completely bound together below with wood, and the holes and cracks are filled in, it has the ability to carry a load.

original: 'jig rten 'di na yang 'dis bstan te sred pas bcings nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'degs nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na yang 'dis bstan te sred pas bcings nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'degs nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in this world, when it is bound by craving, it becomes able to carry the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: chings ma ni myur du skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin shing glegs kyi gzer bu la sogs pa 'ching ba yin te 'dir ni gti mug bsal ba'i lhag ma nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: chings ma ni myur du skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin shing glegs kyi gzer bu la sogs pa 'ching ba yin te 'dir ni gti mug bsal ba'i lhag ma nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The holes and cracks are the nature of the quick-producing, which are the bindings of the pegs and so on of the wood planks. Here, it is the afflictions and secondary afflictions that remain after ignorance is removed.

original: rgyang thag bcad nas su zhes bya bas ni dka' bas spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyang thag bcad nas su zhes bya bas ni dka' bas spangs pa'o //
translated: Having cut the rope, means having abandoned through difficulty.

original: thams cad du yang 'di sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad du yang 'di sbyar bar bya ste /

original: rgyang thag bcad pa ni 'ching ba dang sog mig ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyang thag bcad pa ni 'ching ba dang sog mig ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The cutting of the rope should be applied to the bindings and holes and cracks.

original: gsum po 'di ni khyim gyi sgo glegs kyi gtan pa bzhin du 'da' bar dka' ba gang yin pa ste ma rig pa'i gdung bas so //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni khyim gyi sgo glegs kyi gtan pa bzhin du 'da' bar dka' ba gang yin pa ste ma rig pa'i gdung bas so //
translated: These three are difficult to pass over like the threshold of a house, because of the pain of ignorance.

original: brtan pa de nyid smras pa /üîΩyongs su gdung spangs zhes bya ba gdung ba yongs su spangs pa ste ;
analyzed: brtan pa de nyid smras pa / yongs su gdung spangs zhes bya ba gdung ba yongs su spangs pa ste ;
translated: The steadfast one said:üîΩAbandoning pain, he is without pain.

original: 'khor gtan bzang po'o //
analyzed: 'khor gtan bzang po'o //
translated: He has a good threshold, because he has a good threshold.

original: gzhan dag tu ni 'obs rgal ba //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni 'obs rgal ba //
translated: In other places, it is said: ‚Äúhaving crossed the moat.‚Äù

original: zhes 'byung bas rgal ba ni 'das pa ste ma rig pa'i 'obs lags so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas rgal ba ni 'das pa ste ma rig pa'i 'obs lags so //
translated: Having crossed, he has passed over, the moat of ignorance.üîΩDesiring gain, he is said to have gain.

original: rnyed 'dod ces bya ba la 'di ni rnyed pa'i dbye ba ste de la spyir sog mig ces bya bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed 'dod ces bya ba la 'di ni rnyed pa'i dbye ba ste de la spyir sog mig ces bya bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, gain is a division of gain, because it is generally taught by the word ‚Äúgain.‚Äù

original: de la yo byad ma thob pa la lhag par zhen pa ni rnyed pa'o ;
analyzed: de la yo byad ma thob pa la lhag par zhen pa ni rnyed pa'o ;
translated: Among them, attachment to not obtaining requisites is gain.

original: / mnyam par gzhag pa'i khams kyi yo byad ni sred pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: / mnyam par gzhag pa'i khams kyi yo byad ni sred pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: The requisites of the realm of concentration are the desire for craving.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi yo byad ni sred pa'i rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi yo byad ni sred pa'i rnyed pa'o //
translated: The requisites of the desire realm are the gain of craving.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan du mi 'dod pa smras pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan du mi 'dod pa smras pa //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he does not desire forever.

original: sdig can zhes smos te sdig pa'i las thams cad 'dren pa'i phyir dang / ser sna la sogs pa de'i mthus gshin @216b rje'i 'jig rten la sogs par skye ba'i phyir te de yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dir 'brang ngo //
analyzed: sdig can zhes smos te sdig pa'i las thams cad 'dren pa'i phyir dang / ser sna la sogs pa de'i mthus gshin @216b rje'i 'jig rten la sogs par skye ba'i phyir te de yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dir 'brang ngo //
translated: The term wicked is used because it leads to all wicked actions, and because through its power one is born in the world of Yama, etc. This is also to be applied to desire. )

original: rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa ste tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyus kun du 'dod chags pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa //
analyzed: rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa ste tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyus kun du 'dod chags pa'i bdag nyid dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa //
translated: With its root means with its cause, because craving is conditioned by feeling, and because of the statement: Craving has a nature of attachment, with ignorance as its cause, and improper attention as its condition. )

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The term improper attention is used because it is the cause of ignorance.

original: tshor ba ni dang po'i rtsa bar gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni dang po'i rtsa bar gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that feeling is the root of the first, i.e., craving.

original: drungs phyung ba ni rtsa nas bcad pa'o //üîΩsred pa ni 'di lta ste 'dod pa na ni 'khrig ba'i sred pa'o //üîΩgzugs na ni bsam gtan gyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: drungs phyung ba ni rtsa nas bcad pa'o // sred pa ni 'di lta ste 'dod pa na ni 'khrig ba'i sred pa'o // gzugs na ni bsam gtan gyi sred pa'o //
translated: Uprooting means cutting it out by the root.üîΩCraving is of three kinds: craving for sense-desire, craving for existence, and craving for non-existence.üîΩThe craving for sense-desire is in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med pa na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: The craving for existence is in the realm of form.üîΩThe craving for non-existence is in the formless realm.

original: gsum po 'di ni sog mig ces bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni sog mig ces bya ba'i sgras bstan to //
translated: These three are indicated by the word ‚Äúeye‚Äù.

original: don dam pa'i bram ze ni de yin no zhes nga smra'o zhe'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bram ze ni de yin no zhes nga smra'o zhe'o //
translated: I say that he is a true Brahmin.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis sems gdul ba smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis sems gdul ba smras pa /
translated: Another method of taming the mind is stated:

original: brtson pas chu bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pas chu bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy striving, one crosses the flood‚Äù and so on.

original: shing rta lnga brgya tsam 'brog dgon par ngal so ba na de dag thams cad chu bos khyer te rdzas thams cad khyer zhing tshod pa dag dka' bas srog rnyed de nyam thag pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas btsun ba chu bo 'di ni chung ba lags te
analyzed: shing rta lnga brgya tsam 'brog dgon par ngal so ba na de dag thams cad chu bos khyer te rdzas thams cad khyer zhing tshod pa dag dka' bas srog rnyed de nyam thag pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas btsun ba chu bo 'di ni chung ba lags te
translated: When five hundred carts were crossing a desert, all of them were carried away by a flood. All their goods were lost. The travelers barely saved their lives with great difficulty.üîΩThe Blessed One said to them, ‚ÄúThis flood is small.

original: 'on kyang chu bo bzhi ni chen po lags so zhes gsol pa dang / 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang chu bo bzhi ni chen po lags so zhes gsol pa dang / 'di gsungs so //

original: rgyun bcad ces bya ba ni chu bo bzhi las rgal ba ste khyim gyi gnas yongs su dor ba yin no zhes byed pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rgyun bcad ces bya ba ni chu bo bzhi las rgal ba ste khyim gyi gnas yongs su dor ba yin no zhes byed pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúCutting off the stream‚Äù means crossing over the four floods and abandoning the household life. This is the verbal expression.

original: rgyun bcad pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun bcad pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: brtson bas zhes smos so //
analyzed: brtson bas zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is diligent.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa thams cad rab bcom zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags te lus dang sems dben pa brten pa'am mi gtsang ba la sogs pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad rab bcom zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags te lus dang sems dben pa brten pa'am mi gtsang ba la sogs pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bkag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving destroyed all desires‚Äù refers to the desire for sense objects and the desire for affliction. He is supported by the isolation of body and mind, or else he has blocked the afflictions of the desire realm by means of the impurity meditations, etc.

original: 'phags lam gyis ni rtsa ba dang bcas par spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags lam gyis ni rtsa ba dang bcas par spong ba yin no //

original: 'du byed rnams kyi zad shes pa //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi zad shes pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the destruction of the asravas‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i spangs pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i spangs pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //

original: sdig med gang yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sdig med gang yin zhes bstan to //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs 'tshe ba'i rgyu dang bral zhing mi spyod de nges par sdig pa med pa ni 'di'i nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The verbal derivation of the term is as follows: it is ‚Äúnon-violence‚Äù because it is free from the cause of violence, i.e. attachment, etc. and it is ‚Äúfixed‚Äù because it is certainly without sin.

original: pha dang ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //üîΩgleng gzhi dang @217a * //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la // gleng gzhi dang @217a * //
translated: ‚ÄúFather and mother‚Äù and so on.

original: bcas pa'i don dge slong gi tshoms su bstan zin to //
analyzed: bcas pa'i don dge slong gi tshoms su bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of the introductory story has already been explained in the Bhiksu-nikaya.

original: stag ces bya ba ni gnong sems kyis kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa'i sems can bstan te /
analyzed: stag ces bya ba ni gnong sems kyis kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa'i sems can bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúTiger‚Äù indicates a sentient being who is possessed by the envelopment of malice.

analyzed: dper na stag ni gtum zhing drag la tsham tshom med par sha dang khrag la spyod do //
translated: For example, a tiger is fierce, violent, and without hesitation, it consumes flesh and blood.

analyzed: de bzhin du gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa yang gdug la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kun du za bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang na sgrib pa lnga las lnga pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta bur gyur ba de ni gcig tu mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba de ni gcig tu mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that one who becomes like that is one who is worshipped and revered in one way,

original: gang zhig bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig bram ze zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /

analyzed: sngon ni gzhan bram ze ltar snang la da ltar ni gzhan ltar snang ngo zhes byas pa dang / de khros te yang brgyab po //

translated: One should not strike a brahmin who is a worthy object of worship, a perfected being, with one‚Äôs hand or a clod of earth, and so on, in the manner that has been explained.

analyzed: de la ni yid kyis gnod par bsam pa yang mi rigs na brdeg par bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te brdeg pa ni nyes par spyod pa 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not right to think of harming him even in one‚Äôs mind, much less strike him, because striking increases evil deeds.

original: bram ze bskrad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze bskrad par mi bya'o //

original: ji skad du bshad pas /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pas /

analyzed: mi byed na ni smad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bram ze brdeg pa blun zhes bya ba ste yon tan can la rdeg par byed pa ni smad par bya ba'i 'bras bur nye bar 'gro ba yin no //

original: @217b blun zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i don to //
analyzed: @217b blun zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFoolish‚Äù means censured.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig dam pa rdeg byed ngan pa de //
